node.title: Why Chinese citizens support COVID-zero even if it means being cut off from family
node.alt: A Chinese girl is sitting in a cafe with colorful decoration.
node.description: China now has fewer officially reported COVID-19 cases than Australia, and many Chinese citizens believe maintaining "COVID zero" by keeping its international borders closed is the only way to protect them — even if it means they continue to be separated from family.
node.content:
["Julie Guo loved living among the nature and fresh air of Hobart, which has\u00a0largely avoided the harsh lockdowns experienced by other Australian capital cities.", "But as national cases started picking up in late April\u00a0this year, her parents in China interpreted it as a sign of Australia losing control of the pandemic and demanded that she return\u00a0home.", "Ms Guo's parents insisted that China's \"COVID zero\" policy was the best way to keep her and everyone else in the country safe.", "So the former temporary resident, who works as an interpreter, packed up her life in Australia and moved back to China permanently after being separated from her family for two years.", "Even when Ms Guo had to quarantine for four weeks after landing in China, her family's support for the country's\u00a0strict COVID-19 strategy did not waver.\u00a0", "And while there have been some protests and criticism from stranded domestic travellers and in cities facing extended lockdowns to contain the Delta variant, many\u00a0in China\u00a0support COVID zero \u00a0\u2014 even if it means the continued closure of international borders.", "Some citizens have even urged the Chinese diaspora not to return, after one man came back from overseas and tested positive.", "He\u00a0was forced into making a public apology after he and his family were trolled online.", "
What is life like under COVID zero?
", "", "
Beijing has recently been fighting another outbreak of the\u00a0Delta variant.(AP:\u00a0Mark Schiefelbein)
", "China's COVID-zero strategy involves locking down cities as soon as there are signs case numbers might get out of control, and then testing millions of residents within days.", "Everyone also has to travel with COVID QR codes, which are coloured green, yellow or red, to show\u00a0someone's\u00a0health status.", "A resident identified as a close contact of a confirmed case would receive a red status, those needing to quarantine would receive a yellow status, and healthy or recovered patients would get a green status.", "Not long after Ms Guo returned to her hometown in south-west Sichuan province after a job interview on the other side of the country, her QR code turned yellow because she had been at a location close to an exposure site.", "The local health officer was alerted, and within an hour she was sent to a nearby hospital to start her quarantine.", "But after testing negative twice in two days, she was released.", "She said this swift testing and quarantine process was partially why China's policy wasn't too hard to follow.", "Ms Guo felt the lockdowns in China were mostly brief and targeted, and people could live normally as long as they did not travel.", "\"And there is no such thing like in Australia that one venue allows only a certain number of people,\" she said.", "\"The only place where\u00a0people are required to wear a mask, I think,\u00a0is when they board public transport,\" she added, although masks are also required in situations where it is hard to maintain social distancing.", "
Families separated for community safety
", "", "
It's a privilege for Mr Yang, a retiree in his 60s, that he has the freedom to choose whether to enjoy his time with grandchildren in Brisbane or catch up with old friends in Beijing.(Supplied)
", "Beijing resident Jinsuo Yang has been separated from his daughter in Australia for almost two years because of China's COVID-zero policy.\u00a0", "He said he missed his daughter a lot, but she\u00a0would have to spend two weeks in hotel quarantine and two weeks self-isolating at home\u00a0if she were to visit him.", "Despite that, he believed it was\u00a0important to keep sticking to the strategy.", "\"I think it is a good move. They can control the pandemic and stop the virus from spreading in the first place,\" Mr Yang said.", "\"It is for the sake of the safety of the entire community.\"", "Australia, with a total of\u00a0177,400 cases since the pandemic began, now has more cases than China, with just over 110,000 officially reported\u00a0cases.", "China has largely avoided a national outbreak, but Beijing has been recently fighting another surge of the Delta variant.", "Nevertheless, life inside Beijing, according to Mr\u00a0Yang, seems barely affected.", "\"I haven't felt any inconvenience so far,\" Mr\u00a0Yang said.", "\"I still do my morning exercises and shop around.\"", "
China sees COVID zero as a long-term strategy
", "", "
Dr Zhong is confident China can contain outbreaks.(Reuters)
", "Around the world, countries like Australia, New Zealand and Singapore have all recently given up on pursuing a COVID-zero policy.", "Zhong Nanshan, the head of China's National Health Commission, however, confirmed last week the policy was \"going to last very long\" in China.", "According to Reuters, a major outbreak in July and August resulted in a total of more than 1,200 infections in China.\u00a0", "And in the latest flare-up, mostly in northern China, some 538 local cases were reported between October 17 and November 1.", "Dr Zhong is confident the infections in northern China will be contained in a month, and he said it was more effective to get it under control while the numbers were still low.", "
Fears\u00a0from watching other countries reopen
", "", "
China has been testing citizens en masse for COVID-19.\u00a0(AP: Wang Guansen/Xinhua)
", "In Dr Zhong's defence of the country's COVID-zero policy, he also cited it as a relatively low-cost approach.", "\"Zero tolerance or COVID zero, it's our last resort, \" he said.", "He cited an above 2 per cent\u00a0global average case fatality rate even with the help of vaccines, and explained it as the reason why opening up was not yet an option for China.", "The country, according to Dr Zhong, is concerned about the recent situations faced in other parts of the world when they open up completely.", "Many experienced a surging number of infections, which often led to harsh restrictions being imposed.\u00a0", "Associate Professor Xiaoqi Feng, a UNSW expert with experience in conducting public health research in China, also saw the benefits of China's approach.", "", "
Professor Feng sees the merits of China's approach.(Supplied)
", "Professor Feng said the country was observing how the pandemic has been managed globally and measuring its vaccination rate prior to adjusting COVID-zero policy.", "If any infected foreign travellers, even a small group, were to travel into China, that could spark a national outbreak, she said.", "\"That could cause\u00a0a really big health system burden, and also potentially a lot of deaths, and also further damage to the economy.\"", "", "
